title: Fix Mobile Scrolling and Verify Mobile Compatibility

requirements.summary: Fix scrolling functionality on mobile devices by diagnosing and resolving CSS overflow, touch-action, viewport height, and scroll event handler issues
acceptanceCriteria: Users can scroll vertically through content on mobile devices using touch gestures
Scrolling works in all major content areas: movie catalog, dialogs, profile pages, and navigation menus
No CSS properties block touch-based scrolling (overflow: hidden, touch-action: none, or similar)
Scroll behavior is smooth and responsive without lag or stuck scroll positions
Both iOS Safari and Android Chrome support scrolling correctly

file_operations.description: Audit and fix global CSS that may block mobile scrolling: remove or adjust overflow:hidden on body/html, ensure touch-action is not set to none globally, verify mobile-optimized base styles allow natural scrolling, and add -webkit-overflow-scrolling: touch for iOS momentum scrolling where needed

Fix dialog scrolling on mobile: ensure dialog content area has proper overflow-y: auto with touch-action: pan-y, verify backdrop doesn't prevent scroll events, check that video player controls don't interfere with touch gestures, and ensure modal height calculations work correctly on mobile viewports including iOS Safari's dynamic viewport

Fix mobile menu scrolling: ensure mobile navigation drawer/menu has proper overflow handling, verify touch events work correctly on menu items, check that fixed header positioning doesn't create scroll conflicts, and ensure hamburger menu toggle works reliably on touch devices

Fix catalog scrolling on mobile: ensure main content area has proper overflow-y: auto, verify search input doesn't prevent scrolling when focused on iOS, check that movie grid/list scrolls smoothly with touch gestures, and ensure infinite scroll or pagination works correctly on mobile

Fix profile page scrolling: ensure tabs content scrolls properly on mobile, verify settings panels within profile have correct overflow handling, check that nested scrollable areas (favorites list, watch history) work with touch gestures, and ensure no fixed positioning blocks scroll

Fix app container scrolling: ensure root app container doesn't have overflow:hidden that blocks scrolling, verify router outlet allows natural scrolling behavior, check that no global event listeners prevent default scroll behavior on touch devices, and ensure service worker doesn't interfere with scroll events

Add mobile-friendly scrolling utilities: ensure touch-target utilities are large enough (min 44x44px), verify no custom scrollbar styles break mobile scrolling, add safe-area-inset padding utilities for iOS notch support, and ensure responsive breakpoints account for mobile viewport behaviors

requirements.summary: Perform comprehensive mobile compatibility verification across navigation, authentication, video playback, forms, and interactive elements
acceptanceCriteria: All navigation links and buttons respond to touch input
Internet Identity authentication completes successfully on mobile browsers
Movie catalog displays correctly and cards are tappable
Video playback controls work with touch input
Forms can be filled out and submitted on mobile devices
Dialogs and modals open, display correctly, and can be dismissed on mobile
Service worker loads correctly and does not prevent app initialization

file_operations.description: Verify mobile navigation compatibility: test all navigation links respond to touch events, ensure hamburger menu toggle works reliably on touch devices, verify login/logout button has adequate touch target size (min 44x44px), check that dropdowns/menus work correctly on mobile, and ensure offline indicator displays properly on small screens

Verify Internet Identity authentication on mobile: test login flow completes on iOS Safari and Android Chrome, ensure authentication popups/redirects work correctly on mobile browsers, verify login button has adequate touch target size, check that authentication state persists correctly across page reloads on mobile, and ensure error messages display properly on small screens

Verify movie catalog mobile compatibility: test that movie cards are tappable with adequate touch targets, ensure search input works correctly with mobile keyboards, verify featured slider touch gestures work (swipe left/right), check that genre filters/tabs are accessible on mobile, and ensure loading states display properly on small screens

Verify video playback and dialog mobile compatibility: test video player controls respond to touch (play/pause, volume, fullscreen), ensure quality selector popover works on mobile, verify rating/review forms can be filled and submitted on mobile devices, check that dialog can be dismissed via close button or backdrop tap on mobile, test watch party creation works on touch devices, and ensure adaptive streaming adjusts quality appropriately on mobile connections

Verify profile forms and settings mobile compatibility: test bandwidth settings can be configured on mobile, ensure data saver toggle works with touch input, verify favorites can be added/removed on mobile, check that tab navigation works correctly on small screens, and ensure all interactive elements have adequate touch target sizes

Verify creator forms mobile compatibility: test film submission form can be filled on mobile devices, ensure file upload inputs work correctly on mobile browsers, verify dropdowns and selects work on iOS and Android, check that form validation displays errors properly on small screens, and ensure submit buttons are accessible and tappable

Verify service worker mobile compatibility: ensure service worker registration doesn't block app initialization on mobile, test that cache clearing works correctly on mobile browsers, verify update detection works on iOS Safari and Android Chrome, check that service worker errors don't prevent app loading, and ensure offline functionality works correctly on mobile devices

Verify service worker caching strategy on mobile: test that network-first strategy works correctly on mobile connections, ensure cache-first for assets doesn't cause stale content issues, verify offline fallback page displays correctly on mobile, check that cache size limits don't cause issues on mobile devices, and ensure service worker activation completes successfully

Add mobile compatibility diagnostic checks: include checks for touch event support, viewport configuration, service worker status on mobile, network connection type detection, and display mobile-specific diagnostic information to help identify compatibility issues during testing
